qas.question: What was the name of the possible descendants of Jōmon?
What was the name of the new commander Kanmu appointed in the year 797?
The Emishi were defeated in what year?
The imperial capital extended to the eastern edge of which Japanese island?
What did the Emishi abandon in 793?
Who did Kammu appoint as commander in 794?
Who did the Emishi defeat in 801?
Who had firm control of the provinces?

context: Although Kammu had abandoned <b5_0>universal conscription<b5_0/> in 792, he still waged major military offensives to subjugate the <a0_0>Emishi<a0_0/>, possible descendants of the displaced <b6_0>Jōmon<b6_0/>, living in northern and eastern Japan. After making temporary gains in 794, in 797 Kammu appointed a new commander, <a1_0><b7_0>Sakanoue no Tamuramaro<a1_0/>,<b7_0/> under the title <a2_0><b8_0>Sei-i Taishōgun<b8_0/><a2_0/> (Barbarian-subduing generalissimo). By <a3_0>801<a3_0/> the shogun had defeated the Emishi and had extended the imperial domains to the eastern end of <a4_0>Honshū<a4_0/>. Imperial control over the provinces was tenuous at best, however. In the ninth and tenth centuries, much authority was lost to the great families, who disregarded the Chinese-style land and tax systems imposed by the government in Kyoto. Stability came to Japan, but, even though succession was ensured for <b9_0>the imperial family<b9_0/> through heredity, power again concentrated in the hands of one noble family, the Fujiwara which also helped Japan develop more.
